Dear Lexington R-V Families,

As I've shared in every communication, the situation with COVID-19 is changing daily (often multiple times). The LCHD has issued a Public Health Resolution. It is recommended that the school start date be postponed until September 14th in Lafayette County. In addition, this resolution states all sports are to be discontinued for the fall semester/term as it is impossible to safely conduct these activities using Covid-19 prevention recommendations. The trends for our area will be analyzed mid-October to determine if our rates are low enough to safely resume sporting activities.

Lexington R-V will comply with this guidance. We are working on calendar and other adjustments needed. More information will be provided as it becomes available. Thank you for your continued support and understanding as we work through this together.

#minutemenallin

Sarrah Morgan
Superintendent of Schools

post_text: The Lexington R-V School District is providing social distancing by canceling and postponing large events and closing schools. We want to encourage families and staff to promote healthy foods, good sleep and physical exercise to increase your body's ability to tolerate stress and illness. Good handwashing with soap and water is still the #1 prevention. Students need to understand that they can spread the virus to others that may not have the ability to fight the virus as well. We would encourage students to limit the amount of people you choose to spend time with and be aware of decreasing your exposure to the virus through good hygiene: washing hands, cleaning surfaces, not sharing food, drinks, utensils and covering your cough. We have included a chart that might assist in explaining some do's and don'ts to children. As always if you want more information please contact reliable resources; in this case they are WHO, CDC, and DHSS.

Lafayette County Cancer Coalition assist many people in our area in their time of need. This year the winter Minutemen sports teams and the winter Higginsville Huskers sports teams are uniting against cancer by raising money for the coalition. The Varsity/Varsity basketball game this Friday at Higginsville is the beginning to our fund-raising process. Mascots from both schools will be in attendance cheering on the teams and collecting donations for the coalition. Also, there will be a shooting competition during halftime of the boy's game. For a $2.00 donation, individuals that are 12 and under will compete and individuals who are 13 and over will compete. Winners will receive a concession stand coupon to use that night.

Please join us for Friday’s game as these two schools take to the basketball floor.

On Thursday the 23rd the Husker wrestlers will travel to Lexington to unite against cancer as they hit the mats against the Minutemen.

T-shirts are available for purchase by using the attached form or at one of the sporting events (Friday's game or wrestling match next week).
